Title: Restricts insurers from demanding intrusive personal, financial and tax information from insureds as a standard practice in ordinary theft claims
Summary: Restricts insurers from demanding intrusive personal, financial and tax information from insureds as a standard practice in processing ordinary theft claims where no special circumstances warranting a demand for such information exists.
ActClause: AN ACT to amend the insurance law, in relation to restricting insurers from demanding intrusive personal, financial and tax information from insureds as a standard practice in processing ordinary theft claims
